title: Clinical trial of Rhodiola rosea L. extract SHR-5 in the treatment of mild to moderate depression
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated rhodiola rosea extract SHR-5 in adults with major depressive disorder. Results showed that improvement on depression scales compared with placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Clinical trial of Rhodiola rosea L. extract SHR-5 in the treatment of mild to moderate depression.” PubMed, 2007, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17990195/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: A randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study of the standardised extract SHR-5 of the roots of Rhodiola rosea in the treatment of subjects with stress-related fatigue
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated rhodiola rosea extract SHR-5 in adults with stress-related fatigue. Results showed that improvements in fatigue and attention outcomes versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “A randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study of the standardised extract SHR-5 of the roots of Rhodiola rosea in the treatment of subjects with stress-related fatigue.” PubMed, 2009, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19016404/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Rhodiola rosea versus sertraline for major depressive disorder: A randomized placebo-controlled trial
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated rhodiola rosea compared with sertraline and placebo in adults with major depressive disorder. Results showed that all groups improved and rhodiola had smaller effects than sertraline but better tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Rhodiola rosea versus sertraline for major depressive disorder: A randomized placebo-controlled trial.” PubMed, 2015, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25837277/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Rhodiola rosea in subjects with prolonged or chronic fatigue symptoms: results of an open-label clinical trial
population: Adults with prolonged or chronic fatigue symptoms
results_summary: This open-label clinical trial evaluated rhodiola rosea WS 1375 in adults with chronic fatigue symptoms. Results showed that progressive improvements on fatigue measures by week 8; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Rhodiola rosea in subjects with prolonged or chronic fatigue symptoms: results of an open-label clinical trial.” PubMed, 2017, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28219059/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: The Effectiveness of Rhodiola rosea L. Preparations in Alleviating Various Aspects of Life-Stress Symptoms and Stress-Induced Conditions—Encouraging Clinical Evidence
results_summary: This narrative review of clinical studies evaluated rhodiola preparations in various adult clinical populations. Results showed that promising benefits for stress, fatigue, and mood; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “The Effectiveness of Rhodiola rosea L. Preparations in Alleviating Various Aspects of Life-Stress Symptoms and Stress-Induced Conditions—Encouraging Clinical Evidence.” PubMed, 2022, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35745023/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Effects of Rhodiola rosea supplementation on exercise and sport: A systematic review
population: Healthy adult participants in exercise trials
results_summary: This systematic review of rcts evaluated rhodiola supplementation in healthy adult participants. Results showed that beneficial effects on selected performance and recovery outcomes; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Effects of Rhodiola rosea supplementation on exercise and sport: A systematic review.” PubMed, 2022, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35464040/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Rhodiola rosea supplementation on sports performance: A systematic review of randomized controlled trials
population: Healthy adult participants in randomized controlled trials
results_summary: This systematic review of rcts evaluated rhodiola supplementation in healthy adult participants. Results showed that improvements in some performance markers with heterogeneity across studies; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Rhodiola rosea supplementation on sports performance: A systematic review of randomized controlled trials.” PubMed, 2023, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/37495266/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Stress management and the role of Rhodiola rosea: a review
results_summary: This review evaluated rhodiola rosea in adults with stress-related conditions. Results showed that potential to lessen chronic stress and related symptoms; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Stress management and the role of Rhodiola rosea: a review.” PubMed, 2018, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29325481/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: The effectiveness of Rhodiola rosea L. preparations in alleviating stress-induced conditions (PPPM perspective)
results_summary: This narrative review evaluated rhodiola rosea within a PPPM approach in various adult clinical populations. Results showed that potential roles across suboptimal health and prevention contexts; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “The effectiveness of Rhodiola rosea L. preparations in alleviating stress-induced conditions (PPPM perspective).” PubMed, 2024, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/38841616/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: The Impact of Rhodiola rosea Extract on Strength and Power Performance Under Resting or Mental Fatigue Conditions
results_summary: This randomized laboratory study evaluated rhodiola rosea extract in healthy young adults. Results showed that condition-dependent changes in strength and power with mental fatigue modulation; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “The Impact of Rhodiola rosea Extract on Strength and Power Performance Under Resting or Mental Fatigue Conditions.” PubMed, 2025, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40289957/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.
